channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Chances high for Alert Level 3 in NCR – Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Metro Manila has a “high” chance of being downgraded to a more relaxed alert level this month because of lower COVID-19 infections in the past weeks and the full vaccination of more than three fourths of its eligible population, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Comelec: 47,853 vying for 18,000 posts in 2022 polls
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Almost 48,000 individuals and organizations are vying for some 18,000 positions up for grabs in the May 2022 polls, data from the Commission on Elections showed yesterday.

item.title: All forms of voter registration allowed – Comelec
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Commission on Elections said yesterday that “all forms” of registration are allowed for the extension of voter registration for the May 2022 polls.

item.title: Easing of travel protocols to be applied retroactively
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The new testing and quarantine protocols for passengers coming from countries and territories included in the “green” and “yellow” lists will apply to those who may have arrived in the Philippines on or before Oct. 8.

item.title: UK minister for Asia meets with Philippines officials
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The United Kingdom’s Minister for Asia Amanda Milling has renewed the British government’s commitment to work with the region on maritime security and the battle against COVID-19.

item.title: Another hefty oil price hike set this week
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: For the seventh straight week, oil firms are raising gasoline prices, this time by P1.30 per liter, diesel prices by P1.50 per liter and kerosene prices by P1.45 per liter.

item.title: Senators grill DSWD execs on Starpay
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Senators yesterday grilled officials of the Department of Social Welfare and Development for awarding to a nearly bankrupt electronic money service provider a contract to distribute some P50 billion worth of ayuda or financial assistance to poor Filipinos hit hardest by the impact of the pandemic.

item.title: Palace urges US to prosecute suspect in Pinay slay
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang yesterday urged American authorities to prosecute the person who killed a Filipina health frontliner in New York.

item.title: Citing ‘racket' claims, senator urges COA to check funds Lao spent as housing exec
item.description: Private housing developers have accused Lao of running an extortion racket, filing a case against him with the President Anti-Corruption Commission.

item.title: Bishops honor CHR chief Gascon: 'He was bold amid suppression, intimidation'
item.description: The Commission on Human Rights chairperson died on October 9 due to complications from COVID-19. He was 57.
